verses.verse: And Joseph<WH3130> fell<WH5307> upon his father's<WH1> face<WH6440>, and wept<WH1058> upon him, and kissed<WH5401> him.
And Joseph<WH3130> commanded<WH6680> his servants<WH5650> the physicians<WH7495> to embalm<WH2590> his father<WH1>: and the physicians<WH7495> embalmed<WH2590> Israel<WH3478>.

And forty<WH705> days<WH3117> were fulfilled<WH4390> for him; for so are fulfilled<WH4390> the days<WH3117> of those which are embalmed<WH2590>: and the Egyptians<WH4714> mourned<WH1058> for him threescore and ten<WH7657> days<WH3117>.

And when the days<WH3117> of his mourning<WH1068> were past<WH5674>, Joseph<WH3130> spake<WH1696> unto the house<WH1004> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, saying<WH559>, If now I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your eyes<WH5869>, speak<WH1696>, I pray you, in the ears<WH241> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, saying<WH559>,

My father<WH1> made me swear<WH7650>, saying<WH559>, Lo<WH2009>, I die<WH4191>: in my grave<WH6913> which I have digged<WH3738> for me in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, there shalt thou bury me<WH6912>. Now therefore let me go up<WH5927>, I pray thee, and bury<WH6912> my father<WH1>, and I will come again<WH7725>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559>, Go up<WH5927>, and bury<WH6912> thy father<WH1>, according as he made thee swear<WH7650>.

¶ And Joseph<WH3130> went up<WH5927> to bury<WH6912> his father<WH1>: and with him went up<WH5927> all the servants<WH5650> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, the elders<WH2205> of his house<WH1004>, and all the elders<WH2205> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>,

And all the house<WH1004> of Joseph<WH3130>, and his brethren<WH251>, and his father's<WH1> house<WH1004>: only their little ones<WH2945>, and their flocks<WH6629>, and their herds<WH1241>, they left<WH5800> in the land<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657>.
And there went up<WH5927> with him both chariots<WH7393> and horsemen<WH6571>: and it was a very<WH3966> great<WH3515> company<WH4264>.

And they came<WH935> to the threshingfloor<WH1637> of Atad<WH329>, which is beyond<WH5676> Jordan<WH3383>, and there they mourned<WH5594> with a great<WH1419> and very<WH3966> sore<WH3515> lamentation<WH4553>: and he made<WH6213> a mourning<WH60> for his father<WH1> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>.

And when the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776>, the Canaanites<WH3669>, saw<WH7200> the mourning<WH60> in the floor<WH1637> of Atad<WH329>, they said<WH559>, This is a grievous<WH3515> mourning<WH60> to the Egyptians<WH4714>: wherefore the name of it<WH8034> was called<WH7121> Abel-mizraim<WH67>, which is beyond<WH5676> Jordan<WH3383>.
And his sons<WH1121> did<WH6213> unto him according as he commanded<WH6680> them:

For his sons<WH1121> carried<WH5375> him into the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and buried<WH6912> him in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375>, which Abraham<WH85> bought<WH7069> with the field<WH7704> for a possession<WH272> of a buryingplace<WH6913> of Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850>, before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471>.

¶ And Joseph<WH3130> returned<WH7725> into Egypt<WH4714>, he, and his brethren<WH251>, and all that went up<WH5927> with him to bury<WH6912> his father<WH1>, after<WH310> he had buried<WH6912> his father<WH1>.

¶ And when Joseph's<WH3130> brethren<WH251> saw<WH7200> that their father<WH1> was dead<WH4191>, they said<WH559>, Joseph<WH3130> will peradventure<WH3863> hate us<WH7852>, and will certainly<WH7725> requite<WH7725> us all the evil<WH7451> which we did<WH1580> unto him.
And they sent a messenger<WH6680> unto Joseph<WH3130>, saying<WH559>, Thy father<WH1> did command<WH6680> before<WH6440> he died<WH4194>, saying<WH559>,

So shall ye say<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, Forgive<WH5375>, I pray thee<WH577> now, the trespass<WH6588> of thy brethren<WH251>, and their sin<WH2403>; for they did<WH1580> unto thee evil<WH7451>: and now, we pray thee, forgive<WH5375> the trespass<WH6588> of the servants<WH5650> of the God<WH430> of thy father<WH1>. And Joseph<WH3130> wept<WH1058> when they spake<WH1696> unto him.
And his brethren<WH251> also went<WH3212> and fell down<WH5307> before his face<WH6440>; and they said<WH559>, Behold, we be thy servants<WH5650>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto them, Fear<WH3372> not: for am I in the place of God<WH430>?

But as for you, ye thought<WH2803> evil<WH7451> against me; but God<WH430> meant it<WH2803> unto good<WH2896>, to<WH4616> bring to pass<WH6213>, as it is this day<WH3117>, to save<WH2421> much<WH7227> people<WH5971> alive<WH2421>.
Now therefore fear<WH3372> ye not: I will nourish<WH3557> you, and your little ones<WH2945>. And he comforted<WH5162> them, and spake<WH1696> kindly<WH3820> unto them.
¶ And Joseph<WH3130> dwelt<WH3427> in Egypt<WH4714>, he, and his father's<WH1> house<WH1004>: and Joseph<WH3130> lived<WH2421> an hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years<WH8141>.

And Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> Ephraim's<WH669> children<WH1121> of the third<WH8029> generation: the children<WH1121> also of Machir<WH4353> the son<WH1121> of Manasseh<WH4519> were brought up<WH3205> upon Joseph's<WH3130> knees<WH1290>.

And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his brethren<WH251>, I die<WH4191>: and God<WH430> will surely<WH6485> visit<WH6485> you, and bring you out<WH5927> of this land<WH776> unto the land<WH776> which he sware<WH7650> to Abraham<WH85>, to Isaac<WH3327>, and to Jacob<WH3290>.

And Joseph<WH3130> took an oath<WH7650> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, God<WH430> will surely<WH6485> visit<WH6485> you, and ye shall carry up<WH5927> my bones<WH6106> from hence<WH2088>.
So Joseph<WH3130> died<WH4191>, being an hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>: and they embalmed<WH2590> him, and he was put<WH3455> in a coffin<WH727> in Egypt<WH4714>.
